mods:mods.mods:abstract: Laurens leaving for England, couldnÆt let them go without sending word of his little girls. Miss MarieÆs improved health and looks. Louisson takes care of the children. Pleased with house. Learned that Franklin told Jay about AbbeÆs (JayÆs slave) leaving Passy. Fancies her jealousy of Louisson added to the enticements of an English washer-woman who promised to pay her if she would assist in washing. Immediately upon finding that Abbe was gone Mr. Franklin wrote to the lieutenant of the police who found her; now in confinement. Peter went to see her and advised her to let him solicit my permission for her return but she replied that æshe would run-away again were I to send for her, and that she would remain where she was till your return or till she might be sent to America instead of returning home to be laughed at.Æ Franklin thinks should be left there 16-20 days but will continue to have Peter go by so she does not suffer from cold. Dined with Mr. Pitt at the Marquis de LafayetteÆs; has very high regard for Jay.
